page.title: 18Bashley.
page.content: In 1977 a few Bashley families organised a Silver Jubilee Party.It was so successful they have continued to organise local events including an annual Horse Show. The group are known as the Bashley '6'. This year's show includes jumping, showing (in hand and ridden), Private Driving, Veteran and Gymkhana. Â£8000 has been raised by the group towards a new village hall. Although Bashley is a small, scattered village it has a busy social calendar, including a disabled club, 2 W.I. groups, bridge, cricket and football clubs. Bashley Village Hall Committee organise a number of functions including a harvest supper and a carnival which lasts throughout July. Carnival events include a family barbecue, a walking treasure hunt, a parade with floats followed by a dance and a flower show and fete.
